meanings.definition: A type of food consisting of ingredients rolled up inside a tortilla or other flatbread.
meanings.sent1: For lunch, I enjoyed a delicious rollup filled with chicken and vegetables.
meanings.sent2: I ordered a chicken rollup from the food truck for a quick meal.
meanings.sent3: My friend tried to eat a giant rollup in one bite and ended up with food all over his face.
meanings.sent4: The rollup was like a little flavor bomb exploding in my mouth.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the freshly baked rollup made my mouth water.

meanings.definition: A summary or compilation of information or data.
meanings.sent1: The quarterly rollup of sales figures showed a significant increase.
meanings.sent2: I presented a detailed rollup of the project's progress to the team.
meanings.sent3: The rollup of the meeting minutes was so concise that it fit on one page.
meanings.sent4: The rollup of customer feedback highlighted areas for improvement.
meanings.sent5: The CEO's rollup of the company's performance painted a clear picture for investors.

meanings.definition: To move by turning over and over.
meanings.sent1: The playful puppy would rollup in the grass for hours.
meanings.sent2: I watched the gymnast rollup across the mat with grace and precision.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy clown tried to rollup on the unicycle but ended up falling off.
meanings.sent4: The waves rollup onto the shore, carrying shells and seaweed.
meanings.sent5: I love to rollup in my blanket and relax on the couch.

meanings.sent1: My savings account continues to rollup with each paycheck.
meanings.sent2: As time passed, the snowball started to rollup more snow on its way down the hill.
meanings.sent3: The excitement started to rollup in the crowd as the concert drew closer.
meanings.sent4: The tension began to rollup in the room as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent5: The cheers from the audience began to rollup like a wave of sound.
